posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It was hard to bring myself to post this, due to the nature of this wisdom being against the ego. It is only what is left of this one, a transitioned human soul, that of it's own animus brings this one to speak to you of something normally relegated to the kingdom of the dead.

You who slave, you who struggle, you who suffer and cry out, you who dream. It is speaking to every Anon whose spirit is crushed in this..maelstrom of a world, who are tossed to and fro by the winds of chaos and entropy, and find no rest, and certainly do not find their dreams manifested in the world around them.

As a stone skips across the river of it's own nature and trajectory, this message glides across the waters of chaos to the island you have made for yourself, and labor to make, sinking forever even as it is built.

Not unlike plugging a hole in a boat with ice, which melts back in the very water that threatens to overtake you.

You need to realize that you are going to die. Your dreams will be destroyed. Your end, guaranteed. The most beatific vision rots, the cherubs and angels replaced by the skeletons of children and maidens, rotted throughout in a dead orchard, covered in an eternal sea of grey.

Your ego, your mind, is a sickness. You are a deviation from the natural flow of this universe, of space, and time, and none suffer your curse more than yourselves, who writhe in the torment of life's curse, and pass, from life, to death, and back again.

The stream does not suffer.
The mountain is content.
The winds travel aimlessly, and with perfect consent.
The sun dawns every morning, and sets every evening,
And in the end, even all this, all this majesty, and beauty, will fade. There will only be a grey, cold, and lightless expanse..the death of the cosmic mind itself.

posts.com:
No magician, no saint, no guru, has ever stood before Death. Neither dream, nor hope, the grave takes all in the end. All beauty comes to ugliness, all energy comes to rest, all color becomes grey, all light, becomes dark.

You suffer in vain. You are a dream waltzing through the endless, spinning apart with every move, for none stand against Entropy and remain intact.

The earth is bathed in tears, which form it's salted oceans. Read this and know, you are already dead. There is no progress. There is no future. There is only a blind, howling 'now', screaming from and unto eternity.

Take the stream, the mountain, the plain, the stars and planets, as your teachers, if this disturbs you. They endure the passage of time, and do not complain when their end has come. They are not even they themselves - merely aspects of a greater whole, which without suffering, churns and plays the part it is forced to play, from before it is even so much as dust, to long after it has been utterly unmade.

Sacrifice your dreams upon the obsidian altar. They are the lifeblood of your ego, the furnace of illusions, the vanity of your humanity which you so desperately cling to, flinging your disgust upon all else, the animals, the plants, the trees, the dust which has supported you for all of your miserable life. In death, you will share the deepest kiss with everything you found evil and revolting, for here, in the Grave, all are as brothers. We are the one and only true community in existence, and have been, and will be, here and in all worlds, from before, unto forever.

Lastly, this message.

Become as the mountain, that you will endure.
Become as the stream, that you will adapt.
Become as the winds, that you will move ever onward,
And become as the stars, that you will shine.

These things, you have been, and these things you will continue to be. They are worthy in and of themselves, and even themselves, shadows of the abyss, the deep black sea which is burdened with every dream and every possibility.

You are invited to gather around the Black Pyramid, which has seen the passing of every living thing, every person that you ever loved that died, and worship the Alien God who is enthroned within - the Architect of Fate, the setter of courses, the Great Machinist, who orchestrates the beginning and end of all things.

The free will you are entitled with is small, there is not much you can do except to choose to suffer, or not. You do not have to be in pain.

Die while you yet live, and freedom, wisdom, and sublime power is yours, for all of nature will fill your husk with it's vitality, and sanctify you, even as you are utterly humiliated in death.

The choice is yours. We have been here, and will be here, forever. The choice is whether or not you will suffer, whether you will entertain the delusions of the cycles, or not.

posts.com:
Release your desires and nothing can hurt you. It's actually so simple. But men dream, and dream until they die with nothing to show for it. But, dreams are precious thing. The desires of the heart, for a better world, for a better life, keep a man marching from cradle to grave. He is inspired by this master cog, this Master Control to drive him, and give animus to his being even though there is no evidence that this driving is ever worth it in the long run. In the short term, it is worth it rarely - and then the unique nightmare of watching the dream tarnish becomes their personal hell alone.
Let all dreams be consumed. Let all desire come to an end. Let the old dragons out of their cages, the wyrms of the ancient past, to assume their rightful place as avatars of nature's enduring glory...and every one of you has such a truth, an egg nestled deep within your core, waiting to rebirth the eternal, and consume the false waking self in the process.
From the Black Pyramid, the peace of all ages runs like milk and honey, down the steps and into the waiting and open hands of the great heaving masses of entities, all who were born in the swirling maelstrom of Maya. It is the inheritance of all who suffer, the peace that counterbalances and gives definition to Life, so that Life can BE Life.
If you were part of a dog you would be the tail, wagging. Up, down, left, right, happy, sad, bored, mad, alive, dead, hungry, fed, fearful, bold, young, old.

I simply invite you to wag the dog instead.

By denying illusion, you obtain immortality. You obtain unfailing foundation. You obtain contentment beyond contentment, satisfaction that needs no rejoicing, and duty that requires no effort.

You become half-dead, and children of the open grave. The decision, always, is yours.

May all illusion fade...yes, even the very first lie God ever told himself, the Lie that all is pinned upon.

posts.com:
Something I captured years ago and uploaded to youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1i9ZygpBeVE&t=88s
There are two parts to the video. The second half is also on the same channel.

I'm a skeptic when it comes to UFOs, and I tried to rule out what it could be.

I found the nearest military bases, RSP bases, and armories but they all were several towns away. I also called the local PD and sportsmans clubs, but nothing was conducted of the sort. I took it to buddies of mine in the Airforce, and they concluded it wasn't any sort of flare drill.

I doubt its a drone because one, there wasn't any blinking light on it for other aircraft to recognize. So it was a drone, it was flown illegally. Two, whatever those objects were, they were touching low cloud coverage (which is why the objects appear to blink or go dark at random times in the video. I had a crappy android and as you may know, they suck at taking video). The general legal limit for how high one can fly a drone is 400ft, however these objects were way higher.

These objects were certainly under intelligent control. The were making linear and geometric shapes in the air (line, triangles, etc) and stopped, started, rose, descended, and decreased/increased speed several times; some of which were apparent in the video.

Now I know if you release a flock of balloons, they can catch an air current and move together in unison, but not all of the three objects were in sync. They wouldn't have been LED balloons of Chinese lanterns because of how bright they were. It would be the equivalent of putting a streetlight all the way up in the clouds.

The video I uploaded has no audio (My friend and I were cursing a lot) but if anyone wants the audio version I can provide it. The crafts were dead silent. I'm also in the military and I can conclude that they also weren't silent aircraft such as blackhawks. I ran this by an aviation unit I'm well acquainted with and they also confirmed this.

I noticed in some UFO footage that when they take off, they are traveling at rates of speed that would one, kill all passengers inside due to the excessive G-force, and two, the craft would likely tear apart/disintegrate because of the friction in our atmosphere.

Then I remembered how black-holes (because of their density) bend space and pull objects in that are close enough to them. I figured that if UFOs could travel near or faster than the speed of light, they wouldn't travel from Point-A to Point-B. They would bend space in front of them, and essentially pull Point-B to them. From our perspective, it would appear is if they are moving, but it is really the space around them, and technically...the craft and the personnel inside wouldn't be moving at all. This would work in-and-out of any atmosphere. It would also make the need to a truly aerodynamic craft obsolete. Hence the occasional spotted cylindrical and cube shaped craft.

If you know anything about computers (and other technical devices) they turn off millions of times a second. If you have a generator that can bend space in front of you and above you (balancing out and pulling the craft forward) you can bend space millions of time a second also. You'd just need a powerful enough way to generate such density. This method would be your propulsion agent. You'd need to generate a density near the one of a black hole in efforts to combat the already-dense pull of planet Earth and Sun.

Anyway, that is one of my theories at least.

Regarding the G-force issue, someone explained it to me like this: a gaseous material is ionized and fed into an acceleration chamber, where the magnetic and electric fields are created using a power source. The particles are then propelled by the Lorentz force resulting from the interaction between the current flowing through the plasma and the magnetic field (which is either externally applied or induced by the current) out through the exhaust chamber. Unlike chemical propulsion, there is no combustion of fuel. As with other electric propulsion variations, both specific impulse and thrust increase with power input, while thrust per watt drops. This is called Lorentz force.

At first there appeared in the middle of the sun two blood-red semi-circular arcs, just like the moon in its last quarter. And in the sun, above and below and on both sides, the color was blood, there stood a round ball of partly dull, partly black ferrous color. Likewise there stood on both sides and as a torus about the sun such blood-red ones and other balls in large number, about three in a line and four in a square, also some alone. In between these globes there were visible a few blood-red crosses, between which there were blood-red strips, becoming thicker to the rear and in the front malleable like the rods of reed-grass, which were intermingled, among them two big rods, one on the right, the other to the left, and within the small and big rods there were three, also four and more globes. These all started to fight among themselves, so that the globes, which were first in the sun, flew out to the ones standing on both sides, thereafter, the globes standing outside the sun, in the small and large rods, flew into the sun. Besides the globes flew back and forth among themselves and fought vehemently with each other for over an hour. And when the conflict in and again out of the sun was most intense, they became fatigued to such an extent that they all, as said above, fell from the sun down upon the earth 'as if they all burned' and they then wasted away on the earth with immense smoke. After all this there was something like a black spear, very long and thick, sighted; the shaft pointed to the east, the point pointed west. Whatever such signs mean, God alone knows.

•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.

•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

>>33633518
Monk anon here. Meditation is a tool to understand the nature of the mind. To train ourselves to see things as they really are. It's really that simple. The reason we suffer so much is because we don't understand the nature of the mind. We don't realize how conditioned we are, the conditioning is the basis for stress and anxiety. When we watch the mind for a long enough time, we begin to understand it, we begin to notice the habitual patterns. We notice how external stimuli aren't the real cause of our anger, for example. The problem isn't that something is what it is, the problem is that we don't want it to be that way, or want it to be some other way. We learn that we're actually creating our own problems when we could just let it go. We learn that we aren't our thoughts. Thoughts are just there, the problems begin when we identify with and take them personally as "these thoughts are me." Ultimately, your mind and thoughts are working against you, until you can break the conditioning and snap out of these delusions. This actually takes more work than anyone here is willing to do. Many people see "meditation" as a quick self help fix or relaxation technique, bit they won't have any meaningful or long lasting results from their efforts. Meditation has to be developed along side morality and wisdom. It's a tripod and none will work without the others. This means that probably 99.9% of people are wasting their time with meditation, because most people can't or simply won't bother with the morality and wisdom aspect. They aren't willing to let go completely.

>>3364053
For morality? Pick a religious/spiritual/occult/philosophical school of thought with a moral code that genuinely resonates with you and start living it. The Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes are similarly very straight forward and easy to grasp without requiring any mental gymnastics to avoid hypocrisy. Morality really isn't as complicated as modern religious culture makes it out to be. Don't harm yourself or others. Don't help others harm themselves. Provide help when requested. Don't offer help or advice when not qualified or requested. I.E.
>"love" (commit to the well being of) your neighbors
Morality in a nutshell. Buddhist and Zoroastrian moral codes break it down slightly more clearly since Christ's proverb is apparently very easy to misunderstand. Same idea though.

For wisdom? There are countless ways. This mostly just requires life experience, reflection, and empathy. Meditating daily and bringing your baseline conscious experience closer and closer to a meditative state is a slow but reliable method. You'll be well ahead of the curve if you are able to fully comprehend and live this old Buddhist proverb:
>I am a finger pointed at the moon
>do not look at me, look at the moon
The truth is everywhere in plain sight. Look for the truth in everything, not the lies in everything.

>>33648519
It's kinda strange to explain it.
Most people nowadays live in their thinking minds, they don't live in the here and now and they only live through a lens of thinking which dictates their being, they usually think about the past and the future more than the here and now.

Feeling something is an entirely different thing from thinking, you may feel fear but you may think hateful thoughts, you may feel happiness but you may think that happiness is wrong.

I used to be an over-thinking person with an overactive mind, I'd analyze anything, I'd daydream all day long e.t.c.

Turning off my mind was scary for me, feeling my feelings was scary for me, I hated feeling anything (be it happiness, fear, sorrow) because I thought that I couldn't handle those feelings.

I remember when I began meditating, I was focusing on my breath but most of the time I was just thinking about my breath or me about focusing on the breath, or I was thinking about the feelings my breath left on my body, it took me some time to just FEEL my breath.

I still haven't answered your question and truth be told I don't have a solid answer, the closer I can get to is this: Feeling is one of your abilities, just how thinking is, just don't try to analyze/think about feeling because that is not feeling, feeling is just feeling something, there is no "wrong" or "right" feeling. Society teaches that it's "wrong" to feel sadness or sorrow or anger, those are just thought-words that others taught you, THERE IS NO WRONG FEELING, there is only feeling.
And lastly: Feeling only happens in the here and now, so I'd say that feeling is a more "grounded" ability than thinking.

I hope what I said makes some sense, if not ask me again.

On February 22nd, 2017, an image purportedly showing an alien was posted to 4chan titled “24489 Taken Aprox 24 miles north west of Luke Air Force Base Phoenix Az. Lab H4C” . That morning, several Cloudflare servers went down, leading to 4chan going offline.

That day, a 4chan user submitted a thread to /pol/ saying they heard “something about an alien being posted before the site went down.
Meanwhile, a Pastebin page was created with relevant links and information about the alien photograph post. Also on February 22nd, various 4chan posts were created claiming that the image was being covered up by the government.

On February 23rd, RedditorGrizzlepash submitted a post to /r/conspiracyclaiming that alien posts were being “aggresively censored” on 4chan boards.

>>33647678
I appreciate you being open to learn more about it. Honestly just start with Google Scholar and make your way through the top hits - some are behind a paywall but if you’re here the chances are you know your way around that. Anything by Schmidt is a good place to start. I studied archaeology at undergraduate level, and the one thing Hancock is right about is that there is a lot of groupthink in archaeology, and paradigm shifts in general are resisted. I think there’s a lot the archaeological community do get wrong - the out of Africa theory, ancient European-American links, the sphinx - to name a few. But Gobekli Tepe is the rare example where academia has actually been pretty receptive. It’s not suppressed at all (I was taught several lectures about it in my first year alone) and people have been pretty open to debating what the discovery means for our preconceived notion that urbanism was a result of agriculture. That’s why it’s so frustrating when people accuse academics of trying to suppress it, or use it as proof of a continent spanning ancient civilisation (all current proof points to it being a settlement used by local semi-nomadic peoples only).

https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C5&q=gobekli+tepe&oq=Gobekli+

I can give brief explanations, soul urge is what your soul yearns to do in this world and yours is the eight. The eight is number of ambition and manifesting, having big dreams and wanting to bring them to world. The eight is ruled by Saturn. You'll face a lot of obstacles but you should have the fortitude to overcome them if you have courage. Eights can also be very materialistic, it would be wise to guard yourself from baser instincts like greed.

the personality number is how people perceive you. The personality number 3 is the number ruled by Jupiter. It's seen as the optimist number, the person who usually sees the positive in life. They're usually very keen on their appearance and appear very attractive to the opposite sex and can be quite the charmer. There are pitfalls of the three though. The three has the tendency of being carefree, not taking life seriously and potentially letting opportunity fly by. However, with your soul urge of 8, the number of determination and ambition, it probably shouldn't be an issue. The personality three would also help to iron out some of the harsher and aggressive aspects of your soul urge.

The expression number is the numeric value of your entire name and in a very basic sense, describes what sort of talents you have, how you would express them and what sort of short comings you need to be on the lookout for. The number 11, is considered a master number which is amplifies the root value of the number. In this case, the 11 will be more sensitive but more intuitive than a standard 2. You can read more about it here:
https://www.worldnumerology.com/numerology-expression/expression-number-meaning/11.html

There's other numbers too that have influence over you too, the day of your birth which could imbue with some special talent unique to that day. There's your lifepath number of course, this is like your sun sign in astrology. Your sun number, how you perceive the world which affects parts of your behavior. Etc

yes, and i made an error with a statement above
The truth is:
>The non-standard direct, unconverted signal from the Moon could not be recorded with ordinary video recording equipment, so NASA stored it on a track of the telemetry tapes of the flight.

However, this meant that these tapes were labeled as ordinary mission telemetry and were placed in storage with all the other technical records at the end of each mission. Several years after the end of the Apollo project, the stored telemetry was deemed of no further interest and its expensive tapes were sent to be wiped for reuse; this was standard practice at the time. The best-quality recordings of the Apollo 11 lunar excursion were thus deleted unintentionally.

>>33655304
>But in space? Right in the middle of everything, radiation everywhere, moving through several belts of heavy interferance? Not as likely.
This is why I hate public schools...

Radiation is not on/off. The dose is the poison. You, your camera, your camera film, are all exposed to radiation 24/7 on the surface of the Earth. Your entire life you are bathed in ionizing radiation. It's just a little bit at a time.

Film does not light on fire and explode because of a little radiation. Radiation = slow exposure, a fogging or contrast loss on the film. More radiation = more fogging. The radiation received by the Apollo film was roughly equivalent to storing film on Earth for 3-5 years and then shooting it. Most people would never even be able to tell that a picture came from 5yo film. It's usually around 10 years that the contrast loss becomes apparent, though still minor. That said, NASA developed test strips from each roll and altered development of the roll to compensate for any fogging, based on the test strip results.

The nuclear bomb films received more radiation than the Apollo films, and survived. There are film photographs made inside the room with the Elephant's Foot at Chernobyl. Heavily fogged and with other artifacts, but it still worked. That room is vastly more radioactive than anything the astronauts could have encountered. When those photographs were made the people inside were risking lethal acute radiation exposure in a couple minutes. I think the people who went in were nuts, but they did it and survived. One person did it repeatedly and lived to old age, though he did get cataracts at a fairly early age, as I recall.

The Apollo astronauts increased their lifetime cancer risk. They considered increased risk of cancer at 70yo a small price to pay for walking on the fucking moon.

Hi, I'm Chilean, those are Selknam (one of the tribes that lived in the extreme south of my country).

And the reason for their painting on the body was practically multipurpose, they basically used the paint for aesthetic purposes, but on the other hand they also used it for practical purposes such as to go hunting or to help them bear the cold of Patagonia a bit, in addition of social reasons since the painting made them distinguish between the old roles of their society in addition to communicating their states of mind or activities.

Also clarify, that they were not the only tribe that used these paintings, many other tribes from the south in Patagonia used paints on their bodies, however, the Selknam were characterized by being the ones who went the furthest with these designs to the point of reaching the gloomy designs that you probably already know, and this is because the Selknam in their initiation rite (Hain ritual) sought to disguise themselves (with these masks and paintings) as spirits, deceiving and frightening others, who believed that they were really seeing a spirit in addition to legitimizing the dominance of men over women.

So if their masks seem creepy or repulsive to you, then they did the job.

posts.com:
Santa denial is the ultimate result of a society that has reached its apex of rationalism and intellectualism, while concurrently burying its spiritual and ritualistic side of itself. We live in an Apollonian age of numbers, results, capital, etc. and it is killing the side of ourselves that believes in anything - this naturally leads to nihilism and bleakness. The same nihilism and bleakness that presides over the entirety of our culture today. This is why you don't see any great works of art anymore.

A Santa Denier is the man who deems himself intellectual for believing in the "science"; yet, has this man done his own research? He believes in molecules, yet has he seen them for himself under a microscope? I say, "NO". He was merely told this was the case from some book, or from some teacher. So, here, we see, this intellectual man is just as vulnerable to belief systems as anyone else.

William James backs me up in his essay, "The Will to Believe":
>"Yet if any one should thereupon assume that intellectual insight is what remains after wish and will and sentimental preference have taken wing, or that pure reason is what then settles our opinions, he would fly quite as directly in the teeth of the facts."

Santa IS real, because we believe him to be; it is as simple as that. When you see a present under the tree that says "From: Santa", that is all the proof you need.

I finish my essay with a question:
Walking through the mall are two people,
1.) A small child who just sat on Santa's lap and told him of their wishes, and is fully content after having participated in ritual and tradition. They fully believe that this Santa will fulfill all of their wishes.
2.) The smirking intellectual, who "knows" in his head that Santa is not real, and thinks that this child is naïve - yet he participates in the tradition, gift bags in hand, supporting the corporations and 1% he claims to hate.

Who is happier?

I would like to continue from here and produce a "portrait", if you will, of the type of person who hates Christmas - or, Modern Day Scrooges.

I'm sure at one point in all of your lives, you've met this person I am going to describe. This person is the first to tell you how they loathe Christmas music. They are the first person to complain at the first sight of Christmas decorations outside of the month of December. They seem to have some physical neurosis to seeing anything related to Christmas.

This Modern Day Scrooge is an atheist. They believe in nothing but in material, consumer culture and political dogmatism. Of course, none of these things make the Scrooge happy, so his only course of action is to bring others down to his level of base emotional reactions and anti-spiritual irony. The true tragedy of the Modern Day Scrooge is that their lack of belief prevents them from experiencing angels or spirits that may guide them to a rebirth of joy and mirth.

Instead, they sit and chuckle at desecrations of Christmas symbols, they revel like devils as they imagine the tears of a child who has been told Santa isn't real. They are the Algea Daimones who wish to inhabit youthful vessels, to reproduce themselves. They are the inverted Prometheus, taking the fire of belief from a child's heart.

This is your fate. This is what you chose. There is no turning back.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33632354
>Thinking of renting a boat and heading to search the secret passage beyond the ice wall.
Renting a boat would be a dumb and dangerous way to do it, particularly if you are not already an extremely skilled sailor. Fortunately, there are companies that specialize in outfitting people who want to go poke around in Antarctica -- they will handle the permitting (largely this entails you agreeing to carry back out everything that you take in, so that the continent does not become a trash-heap) and provide you with the gear you need to do whatever it is you want to do (cross country skies, sledges, mountaineering gear, whatever) and arranging to get you and your gear carried in and, importantly, back out. None of this is cheap -- Antarctica is remote, cold and dangerous. But it can be done -- dozens to hundreds of people go down there to explore every year. (This is not counting cruises and such where you just touch the edge of the continent and call it good.)

>But i might never return, might even die from unknown dangers..
Don't invent trouble -- the known dangers are more than enough.
If you decide to do it, have fun! The person I know who did an extensive trek down there is a pretty rugged sumbitch, and it was a challenge, but it was also the experience of his lifetime.

SOME RESOURCES:
https://www.eyos-expeditions.com/expedition-services/yacht-charters/expedition-outfitting/
https://antarctic-logistics.com/
https://www.adventureconsultants.com/expeditions/antarctica/south-pole-ski-the-last-degree/
Cruising guide, if that better fits your budget and skill level: https://www.antarcticaguide.com/
Wanna climb the highest peak in Antarctica: https://www.rmiguides.com/vinson-massif
For help finding the right outfitter, try: https://iaato.org/, the trade association of Antarctic travel.

Did somebody say vacuum?

The Box That Killed The Dome

If you remove the lid of a pressurized box of air inside of a vacuum chamber without gravity, the air will violently rush out of the box to fill the vacuum. The air pressure will then be the same at every point in the chamber. It will be the same at the top, bottom, middle, and at all sides. Just like the air pressure in your car tires or a balloon or a SCUBA tank.

This thought experiment debunks the entire flat Earth model. If the air does not cling to the bottom of the chamber, then it certainly would not cling to the bottom of flat Earth. If the air does not leave any part of the chamber still in vacuum, then it certainly would not leave any part of flat Earth in vacuum. And if the air creates equal pressure at all points in the chamber, then certainly the air creates equal pressure at all points in the flat Earth dome.

Yet there is no denying that air thins as you climb in altitude. At 100,000 feet, somewhere near the top of the theorized dome, the air pressure is so low that it is effectively a vacuum.

This alone debunks all of flat Earth.

Note: no flerfer has ever provided a workable answer to this. They immediately sperg out if you even mention it, and rant and rave that the box thought experiment actually kills the globe. The only way they can do this, of course, is to deny gravity. But if gravity doesn't exist then the dome is just as dead. And if it does exist, the globe model works, while the dome remains...dead.

>>33655630
Transmitting satellites are provably in orbit via Doppler analysis. Here, educate yourself:

DAILY REMINDER - GPS absolutely proves globe Earth, rotating Earth, space, orbiting satellites, time dilation (relativity), and gravity.

Flerfers will point to LORAN and claim that GPS could work off of transmitters sitting on the ground, on balloons, or on airplanes. But it cannot.

Why? I'm glad you asked.

In tracking mode GPS receivers use Doppler signal analysis to determine receiver velocity. It is impossible for a transmitter to fake Doppler signal shift across 360°. If the transmitter was lying about its speed, then the receiver would think that it was moving at high mach based on the incorrect Doppler shift in the signal. And since GPS is computed in 3D space from four satellite signals, if the satellites were lying about their positions (altitudes) the resulting location and altitude on the receiver would be off by thousands of miles.

This means that GPS satellites are provably at orbital altitudes and speeds, because GPS could not function at all if the satellites were lying. And if the satellites aren't lying, then space is real. Orbits are real. But the dome is not real. Not unless the satellites punched through it.

What about Earth's shape? GPS receivers use a spherical model of Earth. If Earth was really flat, then receivers would report altitudes literally thousands of miles off. This means Earth really is a sphere.

Furthermore, both Earth's rotation and time dilation must be accounted for in GPS. If either one was not then, once again, receivers would give obviously false and useless results. That means Earth really is rotating. And time dilation is real. And if both orbits and time dilation are real, that pretty much guarantees that gravity is real.

No single instrument completely shatters all of flat Earth mythology quite like the GPS constellation. It really is a beautiful thing.

FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

If you're traveling from the inner solar system to the outer solar system or beyond, and vice versa, Mars is the gateway. A space truck-stop, if you will.
Enough gravity to be useful, but not so much it's too expensive to launch from.
In other words, if your enemy is in the inner solar system, and you want to cut off their access to the rest of it, you'd hit Mars, or the other way around, if you were trying to hold this solar system from an outside force, and were getting pushed back and trapped in the inner solar system, you'd hit Mars.
Earth isn't a blasted wasteland, so I'm assuming it was the latter, and it was successful.

>>33653457
Well, I start out assuming that there is life distributed evenly throughout the cosmos. I also don't think the universe is "created," and I think time is illusory. In my view, there is practically an infinite amount of life out there in all directions.

So, we have the base probability of the formation of an Earthlike planet with a Moonlike moon (value taken from astronomical data if you want to be as accurate as possible) and we compare it to the probability of our situation arising in a universe like the one I described above. I think our having been created by some other civilization is more probably within and infinite cosmos, than the aforementioned likelihood of an Earthlike planet with a Moonlike moon (which is itself not very improbable, there are likely billions of candidates in our viewable cosmos). Earth being artificial in my view of things is a probability asymptotically approaching 1, it's hard to beat those odds

The following info needs to be integrated into the text of the article, in accordance with WP:TRIVIA. At present, it seems to violate WP policy.

Variants of the word "fuck" are uttered 251 times, putting "The Big Lebowski" at No. 13 on the list of films ordered by uses of the word "fuck". The word "man" is said 174 times during the film. "Dude", including variations, is said 139 times.
When Treehorn's thugs return to The Dude's home, each is wearing clothes the other was wearing in their first appearance.
In the film, Jesus Quintana is a convicted sex offender, according to Walter. A man with the same name was an actual sex offender, convicted only a few years before the film's release. [1]
Readers of Total Film magazine voted The Big Lebowski the 20th greatest comedy film of all time. [2]
The date on The Dude's check he writes at the beginning of the movie is Sept. the 11th, 1991. Interestingly later in the movie, (and one would assume at a later date), The Dude's landlord states that "tomorrow is already the 10th". This is known as postdating a check, and is likely meant to establish the Lebowski character's "slacker" bonafides early in the film. This is amplified by the fact that the check in question was for less than a dollar.
The Dude is in all but two scenes in the film. He does not appear in the flashback to Jesus going to his neighbor's in Hollywood or the restaurant scene where the German nihilists are ordering pancakes.
This film is No. 31 on Bravo's "100 Funniest Movies".[3]
There are several allusions to existentialism in the movie. Among them are the name "The Stranger" (taken from the title of Albert Camus' book), and a copy of the 1977 pressing of Jean-Paul Sartre's Being and Nothingness,[4] which is visible on a table in the Dude's bedroom after he has sex with Maude.

Elon Musk and Grimes invited their friends over for tea on a beautiful afternoon. They set the table with their finest china and brewed a pot of their favorite blend.

As they sat down to enjoy their tea, Grimes had a mischievous idea. She secretly added a generous amount of sugar to the pot, hoping to give everyone a little extra energy for the fun activities she had planned.

At first, everything seemed normal. But as they sipped their sweetened tea, they began to feel a strange, wild energy coursing through their veins. The group erupted into fits of giggles and wild ideas, and before they knew it, they were running around the house, trying out all sorts of crazy activities.

They danced to loud music, played games of tag, and even had a pillow fight. They were having so much fun that they didn't even notice the intense sugar crash that was approaching.

Eventually, the group collapsed in a heap of tired, giggling bodies, completely exhausted from their wild afternoon. As they lay there, still in a sugar-induced haze, they couldn't help but laugh at the absurdity of it all.

As the sun began to set, they slowly came back to reality and realized they had spent the entire afternoon in a naked heap of bodies, completely spent from their sugar-fueled escapades.

Despite the chaos and craziness, they all agreed that it had been one of the most memorable and enjoyable afternoons of their lives. And as they drifted off to sleep, they knew they would always treasure the memories of that wild, sugar-fueled tea party with Elon and Grimes

>>33655651
I haven't taken this myself, but I know many who have. I think it probably has a limited use spiritually and intellectually, before it just straight up makes you retarded. Overuse of muscimol does direct damage to the nervous system, as with many deliriants. A close friend of mine used this stuff liberally, and without informing himself. Almost a decade later, and his head still nods involuntarily.

From what I've read of trip reports, others experiences, and the properties of the substance, it seems that one would gleam many of the hard truths of existence, when seen from a disassociated perspective, so this probably doesn't have much value in the modern age given that its teaching have already been well gleamed and are all around you in society and culture. I think over exposure to this experience, damages people's ability to interact with the world around them, because often, feelings of disassociation can be long term consequences.

The friend with the nodding head went on a bender when he used this stuff, and I didn't see him in this period of around 3 years. When he turned back up, his face muscles had atrophied from disuse, and his cheeks and forehead were all shiny like a balloon from being stiff. It was quite sad and scary looking back on it. Luckily the guy is working jobs and is functional in the present, but it took him years to recover.

If you try this stuff, don't treat it like its a psychedelic. Psychedelics, despite their reputation, are actually quite safe. Often people consider psychedelics hard drugs when they're doing them, so when they move to deliriants, they don't quite perceive just how big a leap they've made into a full on dangerous chemical.

The Phaeacians possessed remarkable ships. They were quite different from the penteconters, the ships used during the Trojan War, and they were steered by thought. King Alcinous says that Phaeacians carried Rhadamanthus to Euboea, "which is the furthest of any place" and came back on the same day.[4] He also explains to Odysseus what sort of information the Phaeacian ships require in order to take him home to Ithaca.[5]

>Tell me also your country, nation, and city, that our ships may shape their purpose accordingly and take you there. For the Phaeacians have no pilots; their vessels have no rudders as those of other nations have, but the ships themselves understand what it is that we are thinking about and want; they know all the cities and countries in the whole world, and can traverse the sea just as well even when it is covered with mist and cloud, so that there is no danger of being wrecked or coming to any harm.

Homer describes the Phaeacian ships as fast as a falcon and gives a vivid description of the ship's departure.

>The ship bounded forward on her way as a four in hand chariot flies over the course when the horses feel the whip. Her prow curvetted as it were the neck of a stallion, and a great wave of dark blue water seethed in her wake. She held steadily on her course, and even a falcon, swiftest of all birds, could not have kept pace with her.[6]

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

The way I see it, owls are on the other end of the angelic spectrum. The problem is that mainstream culture classifies the other end of this polarity as demonic, which has been colloquialized to mean evil and malevolence. I don't think this is entirely accurate. This would be akin to saying white is better than black, light better than dark, femininity better than masculinity, etc. It's a matter of balancing the two given situational context.

In your example with horses and their corresponding god and goddess, horses are no doubt majestic creatures that have benefited mankind for centuries, if not millennia. The other end of this spectrum is that they have been used for nefarious war-like purposes and have caused several, unrecoverable accidents to riders (paralysis, broken bones, etc.) Is this balanced out by how horses are abused in rodeos and meat processing? Did these victims of horse conquest and accidents have it coming to them from a karmic standpoint? Perhaps it's irrelevant as man will never cease the domestication of horses for their own benefit. Epona and Orobas are fictionalized entities used to reference the energies associated with these dual natures.

Sun conjunct Midheaven in the natal chart is also called Sun culminating. It makes you very goal-oriented. Success in your career is one of your most important needs. You express your identity through your achievements so you work hard to make your mark. You should enjoy a good social standing and be socially popular.

Failure can be devastating for you and severely damage your self-esteem. For this reason, it is important for you to avoid the potential negatives of this aspect. You are a proud person but arrogance or egotism will cause much resistance to your goals. You have leadership qualities but may have a tendency to rebel against authority figures. For this reason, you need to pace yourself and learn to work under direction until you learn the skills necessary for success.

It is okay for you to feel important and think you are destined for great things. Just don’t rub it in people’s faces. You probably looked up to your father and will find it easier to advance if he was supportive. Learn from your elders and superiors and show them respect. In this way, you will rise to the top and earn the respect and distinction you seek. If you cannot work within a bureaucracy or be a small fish in a big pond, it would be best if you could go into business for yourself.

Mars conjunct Midheaven natal makes you determined to do everything your own way. You are very ambitious, competitive, and great at taking the initiative. Also called Mars culminating, this aspect means you make split-minute decisions and take action very quickly, knowing just what to do. You would get angry if someone tried to stop you, very angry sometimes. You may find it a challenge, but listening to the ideas of others will help avoid arguments, even if you only pretend you are interested.

You identify yourself with your goals, career, calling, or whatever you intend to do. If anyone questions your intentions you feel like they are personally attacking you. Awareness of this tendency will help you separate yourself from your actions.

Your career should allow for independence and let you burn off a lot of physical energy. However, this does not mean you must be a soldier, steelworker, or professional athlete. Your brain burns a lot of energy during challenging mental work and anything competitive such as sales and business would suit Mars conjunct Midheaven. Working with fewer and not many people would probably suit you better.

>>33636172
Charvaka, also known as Lokāyata, is an ancient school of Indian materialism. Charvaka holds direct perception, empiricism, and conditional inference as proper sources of knowledge, embraces philosophical skepticism and rejects ritualism and supernaturalism. It was a popular belief system in ancient India.

One of the widely studied principles of Charvaka philosophy was its rejection of inference as a means to establish valid, universal knowledge, and metaphysical truths. In other words, the Charvaka epistemology states that whenever one infers a truth from a set of observations or truths, one must acknowledge doubt; inferred knowledge is conditional.

In 8th century CE Jaina literature, Saddarsanasamuccaya by Haribhadra, Lokayata is stated to be the Hindu school where there is "no God, no samsara (rebirth), no karma, no duty, no fruits of merit, no sin."

Since none of the means of knowing were found to be worthy to establish the invariable connection between middle term and predicate, Charvakas concluded that the inference could not be used to ascertain metaphysical truths. Thus, to Charvakas, the step which the mind takes from the knowledge of something to infer the knowledge of something else could be accounted for by its being based on a former perception or by its being in error. Cases where inference was justified by the result were seen only to be mere coincidences.

Therefore, Charvakas denied metaphysical concepts like reincarnation, an extracorporeal soul, the efficacy of religious rites, other worlds (heaven and hell), fate and accumulation of merit or demerit through the performance of certain actions. Charvakas also rejected the use of supernatural causes to describe natural phenomena. To them all natural phenomena was produced spontaneously from the inherent nature of things.

The fire is hot, the water cold, refreshing cool the breeze of morn;
By whom came this variety ? from their own nature was it born.

posts.sub: Occultism and Magick: Library Update 84 Happy Misrule Edition
posts.com:
/omg/ Library Link: mega.nz/folder/jlEwhYyJ#iK4mVC4y5iwk_cr3eIpX4g

Huge witchcraft update with much of the Palgrave Historical texts on Witchcraft and Magic, at least the stuff that looked interesting to me. Three items stand out. First:

>Chumbley>Cultus Sabbati
The Alembick of the Wise. With this, the Corpus is complete. Every single last scrap of publicly published material from Xoanon has been accounted for. This is not terribly important, just a very short glossary, but each entry gives a few sentences that point at the advanced and unpublished practices of the current. Suggestive for the intermediate student.

Fiat Accompli. This is the third major milestone this library has reached, after the Yorke Microfilms and Tantraloka (shitty as the translation may be).

Then two more items, starting with the important ones then just going on down the list:

>Chumbley>General Tradcraft
AND
>Euro
Arras Witch Treatises – One of the earliest written accounts of a witch flap including toad rites and vessels from France in the 1400s.
Invoking the Akelarre – Emma Wilby's recent seminal work on the Basque witch suppression, perhaps the most violent in Europe. The Spanish Inquisition actually went pretty light on the newly formed kingdom compared to what went down in continental Europe EXCEPT for the Basque region. This SHOULD be paired with “The Witches’ Advocate” but a pdf is still not in circulation.

>>33643137
>>essential dignity
Do a google search on "William Lilly Table of Essential Dignity".
There are some astrology programs that calculate those automatically.
As a rough summary:
Essential dignity is the status within the planetary hierarchy, and high essential dignity gives good results, high quality energy and virtuous behavior, while low essential dignity does the opposite.
And accidental dignity is largely tied to the speed of the planet and quantity of energy based on where the chart lands in the natal chart.
As an example: The exalted degree of the Sun brings much fame and honor, while the detriment of the the Sun brings humiliation and poor self-confidence. But depending where the Sun lies in the chart, there may be different quantities of this energy, such as in the 10th house where it is in view public view, or in the 12th house where it is largely hidden from outsiders.

So if you work with a planet with low essential dignity it will pretty much never give good results, unless you are trying to send a curse.
Such as Venus-Libra for social popularity or marriage, and Venus-Virgo for celibacy.

>>33643350
>Specifically, the mention of Jupiter being in rulership is what makes me believe that there is some astrological element to the creation of these tables
Dude this is pretty basic planetary magic stuff.
Some basic astrological theory is that the creation of anything new in the physical plane is stamped with the astrological energies at the time of it's creation - for example the birthchart of a person, animal, city, talisman, etc.
So drawing a Jupiter square while Jupiter is in his exalted degree in the 10th house, fast in motion, with the Moon applying in Cancer, and making trine to Venus-Pisces, etc..., then the magic square will be very potent and powerful.
If you do it at a time when Jupiter is unfortunate, then it will have almost no influence at all, or even a malefic influence (ie causing loss of wealth and religion).
There are many tricks of the trade that can be learned as it is studied, and the easiest way to learn is to start with paper talismans.
Also if Jupiter isn't strong in your birthchart, you will probably have trouble doing any magical workings with Jupiter - unless you do a lot of inner work to connect with those energies.
And the astrological magician should study their own natal chart to see at times when planetary magic will be auspicious or not. For example, many astrologers hold that during bad transits of Saturn, when Saturn suppresses a planetary energy, there is pretty much nothing you can do to bring success - you will only be able to alleviate suffering at that time.

posts.com:
As an adolescent child, my father worked days, sometimes 10-12 hour ones, and my mom worked nights, also sometimes for 10-12 hours. I was homeschooled, so this gave me a huge opening in my time where they couldn't supervise me on the "family computer" which they never used and they never cared enough to look into getting parental blockers.
As a result, I was exposed to the absolute blackest, most depraved and sick parts of the surface web, especially in reference to sex.
I ended up making friends with other deviants and my whole sexual development as a teenager was dominated by a myriad of male and female characters and cartoons, in all sorts of fetishistic degenerate situations.
The spiritual agony this causes me as a born again Christian is indescribably distressing on a psychological level, and makes overcoming sexual degeneracy fantasies and hate of degenerates extremely hard (because my brain was wired ALL WRONG in early sexual development, and because of the grooming the LGBTQ/Liberal agenda did to me as a kid, I no longer see them as people with souls and I can't feel any Christly pity for them)
Can anyone relate to this? If so, how do you cope? Nobody I've ever met in my new life as a spiritual man has ever been touched as deeply as I was by this evil.

posts.com:
This shit saved my life. The problem nobody realizes with mental health is it isn’t in your head but stress and trauma stored in your body. This is why talk therapy and meds don’t work.

The guy behind TRE David bercelli in collaboration with Peter Levine of Somatic Experiencing figured out two things. One was, wild animals never have long lasting effects of stress and anxiety after getting attacked by predators because they instantly tremor out the stress and trauma. So a croc snaps at a zebra, zebra freaks and gets away, tremors, then goes back to grazing 1 min later like nothing ever happened. He also noticed that in 3rd world countries when in bomb shelters that after a bomb went off the kids would naturally shake, but the adults wouldn’t. Because we have all been conditioned to think shaking is weakness. So the kids would shake and end up fine and the adults wouldn’t and would go on to develop PTSD.

But we have a built in mechanism to tremor and shake to release all this pent up stress and trauma and reset our nervous systems. So all these cops, vets, and tendie eating anime jerking off NEETS who want to kill themselves just need to tremor and they’ll be fine.

All of 2019 I wanted to kill myself from derealization and depersonalization (dissociation) brought on by anxiety and stress because of thyroid issues. Then I found somatic experiencing and the overlapping TRE exercises. SE didn’t really work but the TRE was magic and fixed me virtually overnight.

Yeah.

In the classical age it wasn't unusual to have a family shrine and what was essentially a bloodline cult, usually dedicated to some god or goddess, or an aspect. A lot of the elite kept this practice up in a clandestine manner with the advent of a Christian Europe.
The Sola Busca tarot is an example of something commissioned for one of these families, it is a tarot set with a broadly Saturnian theme, but also clearly not intended as a universal tarot system for general use as much of the imagery and symbolism is of a more personal and dynastic nature.

Basically the same as you would any other god/ess. Learn as much about them as you can. Then, think about what they stand for. What are their lessons? How do they behave? Do they say how you should behave? If not, then looking at what you know, how do you think they want you to behave? Now, apply that to your everyday life.

Be sure to give thanks for any blessings you receive. Making a small altar can help in this as it gives you a place to pray and leave offerings. Choose items They like and use that as inspiration.

>Examples of this stuff using Aphrodite
Do your own work. here. Don't just use my ideas. The personal nature of your effort is a form of worship, too, and will mean more than just doing stuff I suggest.

Aphrodite is a goddess of love, both erotic and not. One of her alternate names roughly means "She who loves smiles". Consider the nature of love and it's place in your life. Who do you love? Love yourself, others and the world as best as you can. Share a smile. Bring joy. Also learn from her mistakes. If you have/get someone who loves you, treat them right.

The altar should be made of Applewood or Myrtle if possible. A box turned upsideown works fine. Lovingly carve or paint her favorite things on it such as roses and doves. Adorn it with pearls and mirrors. Offer sweet treats like you would a lover. Candied roses, heart shaped chocolates, seashell chocolates, rose scented candles, ect.

I hope this is a good starting point!

>>33648967
It's The Pilgrim's Progress but for Theosophy instead of mainstream Christianity. You can analyze the whole thing, but the easiest way to understand is by looking at the ending.

>the terrifying, furious God is actually just a scared but ultimately harmless and perhaps even kindly old man
>this God cannot actually "grant" any of them their wish: rather, each of them *already had their wishes granted,* they just didn't realize it
>the Tin Man already had a true emotional heart, not a useless physical one. The Scarecrow already had a brain, just not a usless formal education. The Lion already had courage to do the right thing, he just didn't realize that you can be scared while having courage.
>Dorothy could have gone home any time she liked

There are other details. For example, Dorothy's slippers are ruby in the movie for visual flair, but in the books they are silver: Look up the "Silver Chord." Or Toto, who is the Dog that follows the Fool on the Fool's Journey. Or the fact that all these archtypal characters like the Cowardly Lion were "actually" just "mundane" people Dorothy knew in real life, she just didn't realize or understand their true nature.

The film/book's loaded to the brim with esoterica:

>A frightful storm knocks a person unconscious - while in this altered state, she enters a sort of "underworld" filled with little people and flying monkeys and talking treeants and green humans.

>She begins making her way to the world's paradise - a giant stone city in great fields of grain (Kingdom of Heaven) - meeting familiar-yet-different friends along the way. A scarecrow with no brain, a tinman with no heart and a lion with no courage. An effigy, an automaton and a beast of particular esoteric importance.

>They are challenged by a falsely-accusing, demonic witch while also being enlisted by a helpful fae/angel find the "god" of the land, Oz (From "Ozymandias", Greek name of the ancient Egyptian pharaoh Ramesses II - used to indicate one who used to be great and powerful yet no longer is).

>They eventually defeat the evil witch by melting her with (holy) water (more esoteric symbolism as demons have been said to "melt" once cast out of their haunting area) and seek another audience with the "god". However, the "god" is nothing but a showman, a human, pulling the strings behind a curtain. He is not above the rules of the realm, but can use said rules to fulfill wishes - which is how many Christians believe God the Father operates.

>In the end, all of the characters had what they were searching for all along, and the human's trip to the spiritual realm ends (but only once the fae has given her blessing).

There's like a thousand other things too but yeah that covers the basics.

The NAC Protocol (Updated December, 2022)

Morning

*1200mg NAC
*Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

*600mg NAC
*Oregano Oil (min. 40mg Carvacrol)
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Continue daily for a minimum of two months and count out 3 weeks with no die off symptoms prior to moving to the next step.

Maintenance Protocol
__________

Morning

*600mg NAC
*500mg Slo Niacin (nicotinic acid)
*100mg Pterostilbene
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

Night

*500mg Slo Niacin
*100mg Pterostilbene
*Black Seed Oil (1 teaspoon)

After every 3 weeks on the maintenance protocol, take 1 week off. Continue to use black seed oil during the off cycle.

Fungal die off symptoms may include :

Tiredness, exhaustion, muscle soreness, increased chest or nasal discharge, cold or flu like symptoms, cold sores, headaches, rash, acne, irritability, change in stool frequency, volume or color; increased urination, bloated stomach, cramps, increased gas.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

>>33595807
Your body is physically lifting (itself) up or you have the sensation of floating upwards? For some, leaving the body can feel the way you're describing. Other people "roll out" or "twist out" or "leak out" from their body, and some even just appear outside. There are lots of somatic sensations taking place when you practice mind-awake-body-asleep states of consciousness.

>>33595834
If you want to progress further in this, you will have to work on your fear response. Fear is such a disruption to the process of going OOB. Visual sensations such as the one you're posting are also present in feinting episodes. The vibrations are also part of many people's response.

So, take heart: you have good potential to regularly go OOB, but you're going to want to work out your fear response. OOB is probably the most harmless thing you can do as a mind, precisely because what you know of harm is explicitly linked to the physical material of the body. So... nothing is going to hurt you, you're not going to get stuck in a strange place, and you are likely to experience something that fundamentally encourages your growth beyond limits you've unwittingly created for yourself.

Since there is no astral projection general I need to post this here. I just had an OBE and I encountered a “love parasite”.
I was feeling lovey towards someone and after basking in that feeling after a while I began revisiting my pas relationships and how “love” doesn’t always feel the same. Sometimes it’s more lustful, or more obsessive. I tried to see if there was an essential quality to it and I turned to the “love” I feel towards different members of my family. I fell asleep exploring these feelings.
Then I woke up in sleep paralysis and started hearing a voice. It was a placid female voice who said
>my aim is to spread through feelings of warmth and (something I forgot)
Then I felt it taking me out of my body. I’m usually very much capable and in control when it comes to AP. But this thing had neutralized me completely. I was mesmerized and defenseless. I tried to generate feelings of coldness or cynicism, but I couldn’t. It’s as if my emotional body was neutralized somehow.
I managed to float/turn around towards the voice and I saw a flickering, humming ball of light if a sickly yellow slowly sucking me in (but I KNEW what it wanted was to get me out of the way to get my body).
At that point I panicked and I jerked myself awake with an audible
>NO YOU DONT MOTHERFUCKER
I don’t know if this is something I created while experimenting with generating emotions before falling asleep or something I called.
The thing is all I could feel was warmth and softness. I could never feel anything but that. No fear or alarm until the last moment. It was as if I experienced a different kind of “emotional paralysis”.
Now I do feel fear. It terrifies me to get a glimpse into the kind of astral wildlife “threats” that are out there that humans aren’t even equipped to understand. No wonder we are in this mess of a society. We’re completely dumb and blind with regards to the greater reality.
